overview: This subject (Research Project A) provides students with the opportunity to learn the essential skills needed to undertake laboratory research. In addition, students will gain first-hand experience in experimental design, and in data collection, analysis, and presentation. Students will undertake a pilot or feasibility study in the area of their Research project. This study will be presented, along with a literature review, as a research report and an oral presentation.
This subject must be taken in conjunction with Research Project A (Psych) Part 2 in consecutive semesters.
intended learning outcomes: Conduct research in biomedical and health sciences.
Design experiments to research a current area of psychological science.
Prepare and give oral and written presentation of the results.
Assimilate and critically evaluate existing knowledge within a scientific paradigm.

assessments.description: A literature review. 5000 words. Hurdle requirement:. Must be completed to a satisfactory standard.
assessments.timing: Due towards the end of the first semester of project A

assessments.description: An oral presentation. 15 minutes. Hurdle requirement:. Must be completed to a satisfactory standard.
assessments.timing: Due towards the end of the final semester of project A

assessments.description: A research report. 6000 words. Hurdle requirement:. Must be completed to a satisfactory standard.
assessments.timing: Due towards the end of the final semester of project A

assessments.description: Hurdle requirement:. Lab attendance, behaviour and performance assessed by supervisor near end of each semester of enrolment

email: Past students, future students, general enquiries
